channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large old sofa with man sleeping on it, 25th June
item.description:
Today there is a large man sleeping on the sofa which is hindering people dropping off legitimate rubbish. The bins look full already The sofa was there yesterday along with a lot of household items / rubbish on the street. I have that photo too

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shouldham Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unused work site and rubbish, 25th June
item.description:
There is a unused locked metal framed work site on the pavement adjacent to the corner of Harrorby Street and Seymour Place. The front corner has a spread of free household waste. This continues onto Seymour place where bags are regularly tipped probably by cleaners in the surrounding apartments. Other card board waste in the street
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bryanston Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree uprooting pavement and damaging wall, 25th June
item.description:
The tree in front of our house ( 10 Quernmore Road BR1 4EH) has grown again and the roots are uprooting the pavement and causing a crack in our front wall. It has been several years since the tree was last pruned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quernmore Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees, ivy and climbing plants, 25th June
item.description:
This was reported under FixMyStreet ref: 7733171 on 19th June. Overhanging trees, ivy and climbing plants from 3 Hascombe Terrace / Love Walk overflowing onto public walkway leading from Hascombe Terrace to Allendale Close. This is causing problems occluding the street lighting and ivy creeping onto the walkway creating a health and safety issue. Could you please satisfactorily resolve with the owner. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Allendale Close, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
